intro: Polyosma annamensis, commonly known as the Annam polyosma, is a species of flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenia plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, woody stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. It produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. The fruit is a small, fleshy drupe that contains a single seed, making it an important component of its ecosystem.
